title: With Economic Data Mixed, Why Are Stocks So Strong?
text: The weak economic report Tuesday morning likely caused more selling as it once again stoked fears of a new recession. But stocks ended the weak higher as the S&P 500 moved above a key level of resistance.

title: Asia stocks edge up as weak data lift stimulus hopes
text: Asian stocks tip-toed higher on Monday amid a cautious market mood as investors hoped for stimulus to support growth in the world's major economies.

title: 'Gold is the way to go' as interest rates fall, says Mark Mobius
text: Veteran investor Mark Mobius is bullish on gold as central banks around the world cut interest rates.

title: Oil rises as Saudi Arabia signals OPEC cuts to continue under new energy minister
text: Oil rose on Monday after a Saudi official said there would be no change in Saudi Arabia's OPEC policy as Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman was made the new energy minister for the world's biggest crude exporter over the weekend.

title: S&P 500 Forecast Calls For Rise In Stock Market Volatility

title: Banks Around The World Face Significant Profits Pressure For The Foreseeable Future
text: The slowing global economy, along with low interest rates, trade tensions, and intensifying Brexit uncertainty will weigh on banks’ profitability.

title: Stocks To Test Highs On Hope Fed Is Less Optimistic Than Investors
text: The stock market is ready to test all-time highs on bets the Federal Reserve Bank is a lot more pessimistic than investors are.
